This will prevent<span class="line"><!---->Remove raw pointer and use an accessor instead. This will prevent<!----></span><br>use-after-free in a robust way. It's impossible for any new getters<span class="line"><!---->use-after-free in a robust way. It's impossible for any new getters<!----></span><br>to do anything worse than a null pointer reference.<span class="line"><!---->to do anything worse than a null pointer reference.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1209118<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1209118" title="SUMMARY: AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

Enable Chromium flag: chrome://flags/#enable-experimental-web-platform-features<!----></span><br>4. Relaunch Chromium and open downloaded file "heap-uaf-in-aom.html".<span class="line"><!---->4. Wait ~1s until new window will be closed and browser will be crashed with UaF.<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br>No crash with heap-uaf. Validation if tree exists.<span class="line"><!---->No crash with heap-uaf. Validation if tree exists.<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Short description: <span class="line"><!---->Short description: <!----></span><br>I use following scenario: Open new window via click -> Get ComputedAccessibleNode of new DOM element -> Wait until window closed and DOM tree destroyed -> Access property of ComputedAccessibleNode, which call method on non-existent "tree_".<span class="line"><!---->I use following scenario: Open new window via click -&gt; Get ComputedAccessibleNode of new DOM element -&gt; Wait until window closed and DOM tree destroyed -&gt; Access property of ComputedAccessibleNode, which call method on non-existent "tree_".<!----></span><br><br>Looks like this issue triggered because code doesn't validate if tree_ exists and is available.<span class="line"><!---->Looks like this issue triggered because code doesn't validate if tree_ exists and is         To simplify exploitation attacker can use "iframe" instead "window.open". I attach another PoC via iframe.<span class="line"><!---->To simplify exploitation attacker can use "iframe" instead "window.open". I attach another PoC via iframe.<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>1. Download file "heap-uaf-in-aom-iframe.html"<span class="line"><!---->1. Download file "heap-uaf-in-aom-iframe.html"<!----></span><br>2. Open Chromium 92.0.4491.0 (Developer Build) (x86_64)<span class="line"><!---->2. Open Chromium 92.0.4491.0 (Developer Build) (x86_64)<!----></span><br>3. Enable Chromium flag: chrome://flags/#enable-experimental-web-platform-features<span class="line"><!---->3. Enable Chromium flag: chrome://flags/#enable-experimental-web-platform-features<!----></span><br>4. Relaunch Chromium and open downloaded file "heap-uaf-in-aom-iframe.html".<span class="line"><!---->4. Relaunch Chromium and open downloaded file "heap-uaf-in-aom-iframe.html".<!----></span><br>5. Wait ~1s until browser will be crashed with UaF.<span class="line"><!---->5. Wait ~1s until browser will be crashed with UaF.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f12af1dba9ab5ca8b96a41bcfcad6c9ffc1f253b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f12af1dba9ab5ca8b96a41bcfcad6c9ffc1f253b"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f12af1dba9ab5ca8b96a41bcfcad6c9ffc1f253b<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>f12af1dba9ab5ca8b96a41bcfcad6c9ffc1f253b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/f12af1dba9ab5ca8b96a41bcfcad6c9ffc1f253b"><!---->f12af1dba9ab5ca8b96a41bcfcad6c9ffc1f253b<!----></a><br>Author: Aaron Leventhal <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Aaron Leventhal &lt;<!----></span>aleventhal@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/aleventhal@google.com"><!---->aleventhal@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed May 19 20:12:24 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed May 19 20:12:24 2021<!----></span><br><br>Avoid potential dangling pointer access in computed accessible nodes<span class="line"><!---->Avoid potential dangling pointer access in computed accessible nodes<!----></span><br><br>Remove raw pointer and use an accessor instead. This will prevent<span class="line"><!---->Remove raw pointer and use an accessor instead. This will prevent<!----></span><br>use-after-free in a robust way. It's impossible for any new getters<span class="line"><!---->use-after-free in a robust way. It's impossible for any new getters<!----></span><br>to do anything worse than a null pointer reference.<span class="line"><!---->to do anything worse than a null pointer reference.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1209118<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1209118" title="SUMMARY: AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.           Edit 
        <h3 id="editDialogTitle" class="medium-heading">
          Edit

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
